meanings.sent1: The children looked awed by the beautiful fireworks display.
meanings.sent2: She gazed up at the stars, feeling awed by their beauty.
meanings.sent3: The puppy's awed expression at the bouncing ball was quite amusing.
meanings.sent4: The majestic mountain range stood before them, awed in its grandeur.
meanings.sent5: The ancient ruins left the archaeologists awed by their history.

meanings.sent1: The audience was awed by the talented musician's performance.
meanings.sent2: He spoke in an awed tone when describing his favorite author.
meanings.sent3: The cat's awed stare at the bird outside was quite amusing.
meanings.sent4: Her awed expression mirrored the respect she felt for her mentor.
meanings.sent5: The students were awed by the teacher's dedication to their success.

meanings.sent1: The grand cathedral awed all who entered with its beauty.
meanings.sent2: His bravery in the face of danger awed his companions.
meanings.sent3: The magician's trick awed the audience, leaving them in disbelief.
meanings.sent4: The artist's masterpiece awed art enthusiasts from around the world.
meanings.sent5: The natural wonders of the world never fail to awe travelers with their magnificence.
